etymology.description: 言(言) (yán, "speech") + phonetic: 亥(亥) (hài) = relates to speech -> intention or obligation in speech
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 言(言) (yán, "speech") indicating relation to speaking, with 亥(亥) (hài) for phonetic value, implying the meaning of obligation or necessity related to speech.
etymology.simplification: 该 is the simplified form of 該, maintaining the same components but using a cursive shorthand for 言(言).

examples.chinese: 他该承担责任(他該承擔責任)。
你该多喝水(你該多喝水)，注意身体(注意身體)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ gāi duō hē shuǐ, zhùyì shēntǐ.
examples.english: You should drink more water and take care of your health.

examples.chinese: 我们该完成作业(我們該完成作業)，然后一起玩耍(然後一起玩耍)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen gāi wánchéng zuòyè, ránhòu yīqǐ wánshuǎ.
examples.english: We ought to finish our homework and then play together.
